lines.text: As I wake up, I sit up and I go: Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hmm?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Were you laughing to yourself last night? I just kept hearing giggling. It was obnoxious.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh. I just get ready.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a note, too, for all the drinks you guys drank last night, that probably put you back about one and a half gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Molly, that's your tab, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All but the one you bought me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, except for that one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To be fair, I didn't give you that story.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I very carefully start unfolding my robe and it has my swords very carefully laid out in there from the closet. I do a little prayer and put everything back on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you praying over your swords?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am, of course.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that part of your thing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You seem honest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I try to be.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Our family, and I take this with a grain of salt, were royal guards, were entrusted with these magic swords and these swords can only be activated by the blood of the royal family. So in honor of any fighting I ever do with them, I make sure my blood is at least drawn once.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's quite the story. Can I insight check him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you may.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What am I fighting against?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be deception.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would be deception. All right. I'm lying like a motherfucker.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well thank you for sharing that honest story with me. It means a lot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I walk downstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I go knock on Fjord's door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ey oh ey, good morning!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's a morning person too? Jesus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, do you want to get out of here?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we said we were going to do that, didn't we? What did you have in mind?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we sneak out and then we go find out why there are zombies.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a detailed plan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like it. Are we taking anybody with us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, if they can make themselves not look like themselves, then sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough. Do you want to ask any of them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have anything you can do to make yourself not look like you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take my robes and I flip them inside out and I take some dirt and dirty it up a little bit and take my hair down and I steal a scarf off of Jester's stuff and I do a bandana around my head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, you look like you with a bandana around your head.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah that's not going to cut it, not quite like what we had in mind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What are you guys doing? You guys leaving? Are you guys fucking leaving? You're not leaving without me are you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, of course, we're coming back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're skipping town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. Oh, but we could.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's right here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could skip town with you, though. Do you want to skip town?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll be back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's see if Caleb and his little friend are downstairs first. He has tricks after all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you up to?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Get some breakfast, I guess?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we're already down there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've already gone down there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm leaving a note with the barkeep for Yasha if she comes back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess I go down and have breakfast as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys wander down you find Caleb and Nott already at a table and Mollymauk returning from the bar after delivering that note.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Y'all are downstairs?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (messy eating noises)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I try to pick a piece of bacon off your plate?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (growls) Sure, for you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's like a little dog. The little back foot creeps up. (growls) If we could we're-- did you just fucking? Shit. We were thinking of maybe finding our way outside of the inn for a bit. I don't want to presume anything, but do you have the ability to change the way you look?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To change the way I look?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. You know

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To leave the inn?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, assume a different form.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why would I do that to leave the inn?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we can find out why there are zombies.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why wouldn't I just walk out of the inn?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, because we were told we can't leave the inn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We weren't told that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Huh. Well, that's convenient.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I can change my appearance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow. I would never know it was you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Molly, what about you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I mean look at me. I go into my bag. I do have a disguise kit. Don't I? I think I do. It's so weird to just have things now. Yeah, I have a disguise kit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does that mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It means he can use to try and disguise himself. Hide features.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But the rest of you could do a little work.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beau, I don't want to leave you behind, but I--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's true. I have a disguise kit, too. I could help you out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would you do my makeup for me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm really good at makeup.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could just shower this one that would be enough.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He can leave, apparently.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we could. But not town, we were told to stay in town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, we're going to stay in town.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are we doing again?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to find out why there are zombies so we that don't get arrested for being zombies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we solve the case to clear our own name.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why shouldn't we just wait for it all to blow over? We didn't do anything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I tend to find these things don't blow over necessarily as more they just eventually decide someone's guilty and take their revenge on them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you find yourself in situations like this often?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not this particular one, but yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, look at him. No offense or anything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: None taken, really. A little taken, but that's fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He makes a point. I think that the sooner we find the cause of this, the sooner we can get out of here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's right, immediately the two of us are going to get hit with this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not a terrible plan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you're so concerned with your goblin friend. I mean he's in the same boat as the tieflings.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a girl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know it's hard to tell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I said your goblin friend.

lines.name: LAURA, LAURA
lines.text: You said he.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whatever.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Listen, we've all had a rough night. I know that my features aren't necessarily the most feminine. Among goblin kind, I understand. It's hard to tell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can tell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody can tell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm working on it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's get out of here. Can I walk back into a privy, washroom area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, upstairs at the very end of the hall is the communal washroom.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I use my Mask of Many Faces to cast Disguise Self on myself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, what form so you want to take?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Older, white-haired, with a beard. Just very simple peasant's clothes. Maybe a bit of a farmer or a land worker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, easily enough. Basic browns and tans and general farm worker's tunic and supplies.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Smudges, dirt on the fingernails.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, easy enough.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to help Beau. You know what I'm going to do for you? I'm going to use my disguise kit I'm going to give you a beard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah and I'm going to turn you into a dude, that's a good disguise, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Love it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You really have to sell it though, and act like a dude.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (low, gravelly voice) I think I can do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yes!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to go a step further and tape down my boobs, bandage them down all the way, you know wrap them. Stuff my crotch a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and make a dexterity check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you want assistance with this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was he helping me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So take it with advantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, with advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, okay. You actually manage to sell a decent disguise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I have some five o'clock shadow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At a distance, at like three or four feet would be passable and walking quickly by. Upon close inspection, you could see through it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it like one of those old kids toys where you use the magnet to pull the little filings up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: More or less.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mr. Woolly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A medieval version of that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Herr Woolly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But impressive. Using the kit and using whatever scraps of clothing you can find and amass you manage to get a relatively top-knot Silverlake hobo version of Beau functionally ready to go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's good, it's good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait Fjord how do you sound? Say words, you're manly.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I'll cast Disguise Self on myself, as well, and turn myself into a human with blonde hair and she's going to be very clean-looking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Angelina.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! With big lips, and a couple jewels on her fingers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Just double-checking here, Disguise Self lasts for, is it an hour? Yeah, I thought it was an hour. So while they're doing that, are you using your disguise kit on yourself?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I assume I've just got some very basic black robe that just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, with a cloak and hood and make-up, you can probably pass for human as long as you keep the hood up, and keep most of your more ostentatious garb hidden.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm sure I've got a set.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a dexterity check for your disguise kit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want help?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes please, this is a lot of work. It's a natural 20, that'll do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Between making your skin tone more of a natural tan, peach humanoid color, bring the hood up. You actually pull some of your hair forward and adhere it a bit around the horns so that it looks almost like a cluster of hair in the front. You manage to tuck in and tie your robe behind you, your usual clothing, and then using an over-robe to hide most of the material, and you look like a dude passing through. So with that your disguises are complete, your spells are cast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that your human face?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While they're doing all that, I want to stroll outside and see if there's crownsguard outside, or what. I'm just going to get a breath of fresh air and see what's on the street outside of this place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you exit, there are two gentlemen in full crownsguard gear. One is standing outside, the other is currently sitting in a chair, and as soon as you walk past, they both scan you up and down, continue to watch you pass by.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good. There's only just the two at the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just the two that you can see at the front, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, all right. So I just take a minute or two. I go back inside. And-- on Nott's shoulder and say we're good, yeah, I think we're good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Excellent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we try to do this, then?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In twos, or singles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, of course, not all at the same time, that's obvious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Level two, trying to get out of a fucking inn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's so hard.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now I'm kicking myself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So anxiety-inducing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, never mind, I didn't do it at the time, I can't do it now. No retconning, never mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to squat down over with you, privately. I still think that this is a bad idea, but I can tell that you want to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well it's just that-- listen, there's no offense, I enjoy our talks and your schooling and everything, but I haven't talked this openly and freely with other people in months. It's amazing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It really is pretty nice, isn't it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Still, if this goes south, we leave.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're the first ones out the door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Easily.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. They'll never know who we were.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb and Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, don't say that too much. I mean, yes, they do know that we're Caleb and Nott, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So we're doing this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, let's just go with, and see where it leads.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I walk up to Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hi! Yes, we weren't talking!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (high-pitched) Do you like my outfit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! What are you? I'm sorry, I'm just a young girl from the village.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I'm just a young girl from town.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know anything. I should go get my father.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (high-pitched) New York is where I'd rather stay! (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nott, it's me! It's Jester!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you look like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know! This is how good I am at magic! Check me out. Are we leaving here or not?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you afraid you'll be propositioned on the street?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am really attractive right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those lips are very big.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I came over here to give you the blessing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is that? What does that do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It helps you with your stealthing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, the stealthy thing, yes, thank you so much, I'll accept it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're welcome. Okay, that's it. But I'll see you outside at some point, okay? Don't be scared, come up to me.

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, in what order are you leaving?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should I go first?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we going out in pairs? Like you said? (Deeper) Are we going out in pairs?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Has Adelaine noticed any of this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Other than that, no one immediately seems to be noticing. Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not command ops in the tavern hall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's call that a--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 14, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see Yorda, the barkeep, in the process of wiping out some glasses at the end, she's occasionally giving a glance over to you guys as you're walking around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) You go first!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want to come with?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't do anything stupid. Mouth shut, eyes forward. Show me how you walk. Maybe a little less. That's nice. I also assume a little limp, slight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say for the purpose of this, each of you make a performance check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The both of you exit out, holding your breath. Out of your peripheral you can see the deep reds and golds of the crownsguard armor flanking you as you breach the outer porch of the tavern, stepping down into the dust to the main street. You curve to the left and see nor hear any reaction from either of them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just keep moving to the other side of the street.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I go single just a little bit after, and I rolled a natural 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that three for the night?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What color is that die?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It seems to be iron, like my will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It may not have been the snitch after all, you asshole.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Me and my magic swords.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Apparently. All right, you saunter by without an issue. By saunter, I mean you stumble through. You hear a cough at one point, and it causes you a moment, but you just continue on without notice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, everybody's leaving and I didn't have a partner!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fine, don't worry about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can come with us, if you like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I feel like you guys are noticeable and why would I be this really beautiful woman leaving with the stinky guy?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's quickly becoming canon that you just have shit smeared all over you. You could travel with me! I could be your daughter.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're my daughter!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes! We're a couple, and he's our guard or something, I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! You leave after us Caleb, okay?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Isn't it simpler for you to walk on yourself like a beautiful woman?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, come on, Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, she's very forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on sweetie, let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, mommy!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And we walk out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys don't have to make a performance check because you've exited before, and you're completely visually a different individual, so you guys pass through without an issue. Caleb, you can follow up behind, as you are not currently under direct guard in the tavern. They do notice you exit, and they're aware of your presence, but you are not confined to the tavern. So you guys all manage to slowly come together a few blocks down and out of the sight of the crownsguard guarding the Nestled Nook Inn, and where are you off to?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We did it! Where should we go?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's just keep walking for now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Should we walk toward the carnival where the zombies were?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who was he, would be my question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right. We should find out where he's from. How do we do that? Should we ask around and say hey, anybody know where the old guy came from that turned into a zombie?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a good point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seems to be the most appropriate thing to ask at this point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we could find some public places and just gossip a bit, see if anybody has heard of him, if a friend has died at the circus last night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, you mentioned no sick people. If he was sick, sometimes that word gets around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe there is a morgue, maybe they recognized him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: These small towns, most everyone knows everybody else.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go to, is there a market area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They don't have a large bazaar, but there is an area that is generally where a lot of the simple wares and vegetables and meats and people who sell small things that they craft their own at, it's a small market. If you want to make an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, by going around asking questions and inquiring and trying to prod people to talk about what transpired the night before, the information you gather involves the man who passed away. His name is Enon Brinjay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grimjay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Brinjay. He's a standard human being in his early 80s. He's old, but healthy, it seemed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was he in good health?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seemed to be in good health for his age.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So our war against the old continues.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Apparently.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're the Logan's Run of D&D.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A handful knew his name.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Retired fisherman?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He was helping.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we know where he was retired from and where he was staying, maybe where he was drinking? He had to go somewhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, he was known often to be drinking at The Old Mud Hole Tavern.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that with the weird "e" spelling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, just "old."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm always a fan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "Ye olde."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: "Ye olde" It's pronounced "the" when you see the ye.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I should point out this is the second connection to the Ustaloch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The what?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, before we met up with you two, we fought off a wicked, sick water snake.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It came up out of the lake for some reason.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is this a metaphor or is this actually a real thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It really happened. I almost died.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I punched a snake to death.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She did.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There were the snakes in the circus last night, but it wasn't related to the attack, I suppose.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A little different.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How long of a snake are we talking about?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, it was a giant water snake, then the little girls were complaining about more and more instances of these snakes coming out of the lake.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And this fellow who died worked with the fishermen in the lake?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, he took some jobs with them. Did anybody see him the day of the carnival? Was he working with anyone that day?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't find any of that information. That would be an intense investigation. You would have to go beyond asking questions around a market.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the lake within the city limits?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's technically considered part of the city. It might not be an issue.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where's Ye Olde Mud Hole Tavern at?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Mud Hole Tavern, you've been to before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was doing my rounds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, when you first entered the city, so you can--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Lochward, is that what we're talking about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Lochward is where the Old Mud Hole would be at. The Lochward is to the eastern side of the entire city. The Lochward is the central one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The wards border the lake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's flipping through and glances up and gives you a look as you enter. "Can I help you? Are you "looking for drinks? Can I get you anything?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I would really love a drink and I sit down next to him. What do you have? I need something heavier than a trost. I've had enough trosts to last me a lifetime.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We have liquor."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will take your liquor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whiskey, everyone?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughing)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I let her have any whiskey she wants. Oh, that's pretty good. 17.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've been doing a pub crawl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes and lines up a few small containers, fills whiskey for all of you. "All right, that "will be eight silver for the batch."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have that. I pull out eight silver. Oh wait, silver, did you say? I do not have eight silver.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's okay. I have it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (high-pitched voice) I mean, sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes the silver and puts it away, slides the drinks to the rest of you and goes back to his book and starts thumbing through again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Honestly, it's been a terrible 24 hours. We were at the circus last night and I did not know him well, but old man Brinjay fell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks up and goes, "Enon, it's sad to see him go and many of us were wondering what day it "was going to be."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you know him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's a lonely man."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was a terrible way to go. I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just sad to lose a patron."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know who was talking to him the day of the carnival?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't recall. Sometimes he would tell stories to whoever was willing to listen and not "most were willing to listen."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was he here that day?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yesterday?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I think he came in briefly for a drink before the carnival, but that was it."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, we should drink to old stories of Brinjay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (shushes)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I down my shot. What did the man drink out of curiosity? What was his final drink? I'm a bit of a macabre person myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's this very whiskey you just had."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take one more, and I'll get one of my own.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I heard he was sick, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't believe he was ill. I hope not. He seemed to be rather wasting away. You shouldn't be doing so much manual labor at that age."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What labor was he doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He carries stuff around from small tasks to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Down at the docks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The docks, up at the North Ward. He carried crates, boxes. Just odd jobs, ways to get by 'til "the end of his days, which now that they've come, may he rest and not have to do odd jobs ever "again." He pours his own bit of whiskey.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Cheers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know who he was doing odd jobs for that day?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your lady voice is worse than mine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "To be honest, if he did, I wasn't paying attention."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sure his family will miss him very much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's nobody nearby. He had a son about 35 years ago, but he got married and went up "north."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did he work for any of the particular breweries around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know. Maybe."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Brinjay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where did he sit in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He points over to the not the table the guy is playing solitaire on, but the empty table to the right of him. "Usually right there in the corner."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go sit in the corner. I'm going to look for anything I can find that looks like an old man was touching it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm really good at these. 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a very good table. It's seen some rough days.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we were to go down to the docks and ask after a few people he worked with, is there anyone you know that we should speak to, familiar of his?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I apologize. I served him drinks and pretended to listen to him many times, but I "wasn't really paying attention."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I understand that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there anyone who did? That wasn't hypothetical.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe. I apologize. I spend most of my days reading." He lifts the book.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's the book?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You read!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Subtle, guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We got a reader. While they're doing this, I'm going to saunter over to the card player.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I see what's on the spine of that book from where I am?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At a glance at it, it's in Zemnian, which you can read. The translation would come about to The Rosed Embrace.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A romance novel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is Fabio on the cover?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How's your trashy novel? Is it a good one? No judgement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's not trashy. It's very tasteful."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh no, I'm fluent in Zemnian. I've read all of his works.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Have you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mutual fan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I didn't realize there was another Samuel fan in here. Which is your favorite?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I love the Farthing's Embrace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't read that one."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's an early one. He actually did it under a pseudonym. He did a whole series under that pseudonym, short stories.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What is it again?" He goes over and grabs a piece of chalk in the back and starts, "It was--?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Farthing's Embrace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Mein Gott, I did not know about this. I may have to send out Zadash and see if we can find "some of those books. Thank you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're a big reader or just Samuel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It depends on what you can find."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I read a lot, but all I've been able to find in this town is that parchment place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The parchment place is good for trash. If you're looking for unique stuff, there's a few "places you can go."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here in town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Here in town, yeah. If you're having a hard time finding a specific book, I would recommend "going to Burnished Bibelots."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Burnished Bibelots. Which ward is that in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is in the North Ward, just on the outskirts of the main market street. It's a bit of "a cluttered mess, but Oglen would be happy to help you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oglen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oglen."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is good to know. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not to worry."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Those are hard to find, the Farthing's Embrace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I imagine so. It can't be that bad."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He wasn't as proud of them. Early work and all that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If I cannot find it in Zadash, I will get it from Rexxentrum."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That would be the place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's your name?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My name is Caleb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Caleb. Pleasure to meet you. I am Vosna."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you for the drink, Vosna. I'll be taking my leave now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. If anybody else is a reader as well, come by and talk sometime."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not there at all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This has been quite a day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there pictures? (in high-pitched voice) Is there pictures?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pictures are up in here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Sounds exciting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I sneak my undrunk whiskey to Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I take out my flask from my leg, unscrew it, and pour it in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you guys think? Should we stay here? Should we go somewhere else?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We got to get Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just sat down for a moment with this solitaire player.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I slide the rest of my whiskey over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you a devil?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've been called worse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't play with devils."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just a man who saw another man die yesterday. It's been heavy on my conscience and I was just wondering if there was anything you could tell me about Enon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Enon wanted to go to that bloody circus."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm regretting it myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I told him not to go. Stupid, it is for the common folk and the young. He's always had his "head in the clouds."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Has he? That's not what other people have said.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Other people are stupid."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why do you think he went? Why do you think that happened to him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing but spooks and magicians and things that "want to take your life and take your money, take your family, whisk you away. Fuck the circus."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fuck the circus. So that's what you think happened to him, then? I feel like there's something evil afoot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Says the devil."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Again, I've been called worse. Sure you have in your time, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes the drink, sips it. "Don't come 'round here no more."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I take my cup back. Down it. I love small towns.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shithead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We head outside. Well, that was revealing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No one really paid attention to him, he was old, he had no family, his son's gone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Awfully convenient.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Awfully convenient. Still awfully convenient that your little circus doesn't allow the elderly, which you never fully explained, and he happened to be one of the oldest people in that circus. Where did that rule come from? The sick makes sense, I asked you that before, but why elderly?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That rule's been around for as long as I can remember because it makes people think the show's dangerous. Gives them a thrill.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're worried about them having a heart attack or something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not really worried about people having a heart attack; we want people to be worried about having a heart attack, because then they're more excited to come see the show. This is how these shows work.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you know who implemented that rule?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Before my time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In his defense, every carnival I've gone to has said no sick people, no old people.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a boilerplate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Still a good candidate.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you were trying to hide doing something to someone it's a great candidate. If I was trying to get away with something, terrible idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seems to be a lot of pretty bigoted people in this town who don't like tieflings and other strange lots. Jester, you actually said one of the smartest things of the night, which is-- you did, yeah. Which is, guard's really weird.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The guards are really weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Crownsguards. As you were saying, the Ustaloch?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What kind of weird?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like, you know, they-- What kind of weird? (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They seem to be the one connecting through-line. Also, what's her name, Norda? Mentioned that she didn't want to let you lot in, but made an exception. I don't know, if I wanted to do something, and if I already knew a bunch of people were upset and angry at a circus and strange people coming in, it's easy framing, in my opinion.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bingo.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That, or if you're up to no good and you don't want to get caught, blame it on the easy frame. The weirdos who just rolled into town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great, so we just need to investigate the guards.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That might be harder to do. Maybe we go down to the Lochward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Start at the docks, but I'll keep that in mind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know, it might not be the guards. There might be another through-line that we're missing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we need to question the guards?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That sounds terrible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should tell them they can't leave town.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, that's a good idea, yeah! Maybe when they question us--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We turn it around!

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was about-- nope, nevermind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was about to be very impressed, but I take it back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aw.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far is it from where we are to the Lochward?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a quick jaunt over to the edge of the Ustaloch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So the Ustaloch is the docks? It's what they called the ward, or it's the lake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the giant lake that the docks are up against. The city is built against this giant, kidney bean-shaped lake.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What does "usta" mean? What does "usta" come from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you speak Zemnian?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You speak Zemnian.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do speak Zemnian.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What does "usta" mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It means--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you know?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I just wanted to fuck with you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's been a while, but osten means lake. No, it's not Lake Lake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially, it just means "an east lake."

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA
lines.text: East Lake.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not too complicated.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd like to avoid the guards for as long as possible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Agreed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's head down to the docks. Keeping an eye out for crownsguard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys make your way towards the Ustaloch and the Dockward there, we'll go and take a break. We'll be back in a few minutes. We'll continue to unveil this mystery.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is exciting. Gripping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thanks, Sam. Congratulations to AvilynRain, AvilynRain in the Twitch chat! You won the awesome Wyrmwood prize package. Danoba will be in contact with you to get your contact information and get that sent out to you. Congratulations.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love how we just went through every rain song in about 30 seconds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can look out and see the outline of them against the horizon. You see a couple of small landmasses in the center of the loch, that are barely out of view. You approach, and the first couple of fishermen that walk past you both look to be hardened in their years. Their skin is very battered by the sun, it's wrinkled and dark from constant beating of the sky upon them. They glance over at this unique-looking troupe as they approach. They stop and don't say anything, they just look at you like "What are you doing here?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we still have Disguise Self up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have it for maybe ten more minutes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we see any King's Guard? Crownsguard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Crownsguard? Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 11, same.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing about, you don't see any crownsguard in the immediate vicinity of the Lochward. You've seen them, they patrol the town and walk through, ward to ward, but you don't see any at the moment, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Looks like we're ahead of them in the investigation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Jester. Do you happen to remember the name of that guy whose daughter we saved from the snake?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's see if I wrote it down in my sketchbook.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, because I didn't write it down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: King Bertrand?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nope, I didn't.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You remember where he lives, mostly, because you were there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could go by there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We could go by. He seems to like us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He worked out there, right?

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys make your way along the edge of the loch to the outside of the fisherman's house. The house is currently being repaired. You can see in the main doorway, the door is off the hinges, and there's a large pile of ruined furniture and cabinets that have been shifted out of the building. You can also see a

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's the snake I punched.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's your work? That's impressive. You took it all by yourself?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, no. They helped me. I'm not an egomaniac. They fucking helped me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But I saw your guns last night. You probably took the lead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Give credit to the whole damn group, move on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Flattery got you nowhere.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm comparing the snake to the snake that's tattooed on my hand to try and get the heads to be the exact same size.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have been in the woods for too long. I've forgotten how to talk to people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your game is really suffering.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks for the damn compliment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you approach, the young man with this large, sharpened knife-- it looks like it may have been a heavy butchering knife that he's using to fillet and pull the skin off the snake. Looks back at you guys and doesn't know what's going on. You hear a voice go, "Hey!" You look up and you see the fisherman that you saw before, the one who came to you guys in the tavern. He's up on top of the roof, and he's currently boarding some portions of it. It looks like a part of the roof had been damaged in the fray. He goes, "Hold on," gets up, and comes down the ladder on the side and approaches. You can see he's sweating. "I'm so sorry, I didn't know you were coming. What can I "do for you?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry for dropping in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we look like ourselves yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, actually. This is an interesting point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. None of you look the same.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right, no, thank you for reminding me. He comes out and he goes, "How can I help "you?" (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's us!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's me. I pull the hat off and pull my hair up. It's Beauregard. We killed your snake?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (in normal voice) Pretend that I don't talk-- (in human accent) Pretend that I don't talk like this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck it, I drop Disguise Self.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes,"Ah!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sorry to deceive you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm very confused.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh no. Don't worry about it. What was your name, friend?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Rinaldo."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rinaldo! That's what it was. I knew it was an R! Okay, Rinaldo.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Rinaldo, this snake that was in your house is not the only strange occurrence that's been happening. We're trying to find out the cause of it. Have you seen anything else like this in the time that's passed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's been two in the last few months that have come up. It's a bit of a nuisance."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you seen any zombies coming out of the lake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Zombies? What are you talking about?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're asking after a man that helped down at the docks, named Enon. Have you heard of him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Enon?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Enon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, I worked with him a couple times. He comes through, looking for work, asking to see what's available."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You obviously have not heard the news from the traveling circus in town. From last night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. That's the big blue tent, right?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's correct.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, what's going on?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Enon turned into a zombie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (louder) Enon turned into a zombie! (whispering) And was killed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wow, that's really terrible. I'm sorry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We were trying to see if he might have worked with people that might have known what he was doing that day, earlier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not for a week, at least."

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there anything out of the ordinary from the past week or two that comes to mind? Anything off about the run-of-the-mill stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Other than a giant fucking snake ruining my house, but not that comes to mind, no. Circus "coming into town, that's a little weird."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I see you're skinning the beast. Can I ask why?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm not going to let it go to waste. That's some good meat. Some good skin."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You mentioned the circus coming to town as weird. Why?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Because there's a circus in town."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He just means out of the ordinary, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah. We don't get many shows and traveling folk. Last time this was here, a year ago, it came "and went in a week."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You said you hadn't seen this-- hi. You said you hadn't seen this person in a week? Was that unusual?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. I didn't keep up with him. He came through every now and then. I had a little cash "and needed some help hauling things around. I asked for his assistance. He was an old fella, and "it was less that he was helpful and more that we wanted to help when we could."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we went down to the docks where he worked, is there anyone that we should ask for, to speak to, who might have known him better?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Your guess is as good as mine. To be fair, although we're a community, we're also relatively "competitive. You understand."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You think anyone would have wanted him marked or harmed in some way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't think so. He's an old man. I haven't seen or heard anyone-- his disposition "seemed positive enough, if a little sad and lonely."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you think of anything, or if you hear anyone speak about him, you can find us at the Nestled Nook Inn. We'd appreciate anything, if it happens to reach your ears.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. Let me finish up here with the roof and I'll ask around, see if anything comes up."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Much obliged.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How's your little girl doing? Sorry, I cover my beard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It just wasn't expected."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, she's doing great. She's been a little spooked, but she slept well last night. She's "doing fine. Thank you again for what you guys did for me."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? For what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We saved a little girl!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yes, that's right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you see any zombies, please let us know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I will. You were so kind to help me when I saw a snake, I figure if I see a zombie, you'd "also be helpful."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We would, definitely. We already killed a zombie too!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is just a snake. This is a big, weird snake I'm looking at?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can inspect it if you want.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I've been looking at the snake this entire time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, we have one of its fangs. I pulled it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, don't do those much either.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a fang too, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine? You don't know much about snake biology. It's hard to tell if it's out of the ordinary. It's just a big snake.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Looks like mine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Only bigger.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Much bigger.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shall we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck. Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We are the best detectives ever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we are really doing bad at this detective thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should probably wrap up whatever we're doing. I imagine they're going to come by the inn soon and try and speak with us. Not you two.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We didn't leave any sort of Ferris Bueller-y thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope. No stuffed beds, no recordings on the old VHS.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you guys doing? Where are you going?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there anywhere else that we need to inspect? The carnival or more docks stuff?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like going back to the carnival is probably a bad idea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd say the docks are his home, if we could figure out where he lived.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where he was last seen.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He was last seen at the circus!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Rinaldo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know where Enon lives?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wish I could be of more help."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You don't happen to know what happened to his son, by any chance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I didn't even know he had a son."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: See? We're better investigators than this guy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But he's not trying to investigate!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I take the compliment. I'm putting it my pocket. I'm keeping it for later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He climbs back up the ladder to the roof.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm starting to think that following Enon's story isn't necessarily going to lead us here. He seems like a random victim.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, 14 year old kid!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He has this puffy red 'fro going on. He looks pale, fresh to this, scrawny. He's stopped drawing his blade across the snake. "Yeah?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you live here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, I live about three houses up."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you go to the carnival?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Last night? Yeah, I was there."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, where were you at the carnival?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I actually snuck in under the tent after it had started."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right, that's a good thing. Were you close to Enon? In the show. Were you on that side or the other side? Did you see the zombie?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I saw him a little bit. He was in the front and I had people in front of me, but I think I saw "some of it. It was pretty cool."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was kind of crazy, right? Have you heard any ghost stories around town lately? About scary things happening?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My grandma told me a ghost story years ago about these giant badger creatures that live on "the hills of the Ashkeeper that can stand up on their hind legs, and they come down and they eat "kids that don't go to bed in time."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit. Those guys are scary, I've heard of them. You should be really careful. Have you heard anything about zombies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, not since that."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caleb has seen some shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have to finish the--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, listen, if you hear any other ghost stories, you come and find us, okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we just going from person to person in town telling them to come find us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We are really terrible at this!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, she's making friends with everybody. I don't see any of you making friends.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm a little concerned that we've been gone for a while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, maybe we should get back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe let these two, that aren't under house arrest--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Continue the investigation? Or go back?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, continue. I mean, if you're up for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, We'll be a regular--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we've done nothing wrong. We're not sweating it. I'm not sweating--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I believe you completely. That was very believable. I'm going to give you another blessing before you leave, okay?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are you talking about? None of us did anything. None of us! We protected the people of this town!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's easy. Let's go solve a mystery, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Were you being sarcastic-- oh, no you weren't, okay. Catching up on that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, kids don't know anything about this, old people don't know anything about this--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tavern-keeper doesn't know anything about this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Only the pure of heart make their answer out of riddles. Back to the tavern.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But pure of heart! Still going back to the guards thing! Back to the tavern, let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were we just on the docks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you guys were at the docks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We came up with bupkus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We didn't ask anybody, we went straight to the house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, we'll walk around the docks and look for--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll see you back at the inn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we run back, or should we saunter back?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're going to probably, you know, poof.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, how much time does she have?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: About a minute?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's about to fade.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I figured it had already happened probably midway talking to the kid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe super stealthily back?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. I put my hood up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can maybe put a rope through the window.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's a good idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it a two-story?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a two-story. You guys are up in the second story.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got rope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do that, yeah. We'll sneak around the back of the inn, and try to climb up the upstairs window.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can keep them busy at the front door.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll go through the front like a proper person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys are setting up a rope to climb up the back? You go in, on your own, up to the top, you put a rope through--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord's distracting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In the front. Then we're going to try to sneak--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Right, and then I'm going to drop some of the rope out the back window for them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Easy enough to do, so those of you who want to wait and can take the rope up, you wait for a moment where nobody's watching and climb your way up into the inn safely and get to your rooms. You two, what are you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (singing) 50 feet of hemp rope, it's a standard!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey kiddo, do you want a piggy-back?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, that sounds like a good idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scramble up, let's go talk to some people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'll jump on Caleb's back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll wander down to where people are working. Where people are moving crates around.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's on Caleb's back!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that would be probably closer to the Northward.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, so that's the plan, is to look for people moving crap around, the same way that Enon is said to have. So that's what we'll do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shall I help, or no?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not that great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You aiding him would give him an advantage in the roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh! That didn't help. 12 for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take a couple hours wandering through the Northward, asking questions, and most of the information you get is, they have no idea who that is, or like, "Ah, he died? It's about time."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And there's no point even asking questions because we've asked them all for two hours, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say yeah, based on that roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, well that's a big zero. You want to go book shopping with me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I believe that gentleman said that the Burnished Bibliots was in the Northward, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe you are correct. Yeah, it's in the southern portion of the Northward by where it borders the Lochward.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, so I'll start asking questions to get us there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Easily enough. You eventually are led to it, and you come to a closet that's affixed to another building. The wood used are almost driftwood and heavily weathered, and the front door is closed as you approach. It looks like a glorified storage shed that has been bolted and put up against another structure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, well I will walk up to the door and knock on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (knocks) No response.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there any breaks in the door or the building or cracks that Frumpkin could fit into?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably not enough for a cat to slip through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there any windows or anything or is it all a big, dirty, dingy mess?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are windows, but if you look at the back of the windows all you see is scraps of material, stacks of books, piles of boxes and crates, it's literally blocked out with things stacked up against it from the interior.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How busy is the front of this place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not busy at all, it's just the two of you, right now, standing at the front door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No one's around us, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not on the main street, it's a little pushed back, recessed about ten or 15 feet from the main road so there's no one immediately around you. But there are people walking back and forth on the road behind but you're out in the open, per se.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And no one's coming to the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No one's come to the door yet, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Want me to break in?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: [knocking]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. A moment passes and you hear, "Hold on!" The door opens. It was open. There's the sound of heavy sacks go tumbling down to the interior of it and you glance around and you hear a voice go, "Can I help you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hello?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look down, and there's this crotchety-looking scrawny old gnome who's sitting there in the doorway. He's got this vibrant puff, like a cotton ball, of hair around his head. But it's this perfect "U" of bald on top. No glasses, eyes are very small and beady, and he has this bulbous, round nose at the front with this little bit of a tuft of chin white hair that matches the cotton ball tuft on the sides. He's sitting there clutching the top of the knob on the inside which is actually affixed shorter on the door and he goes, "Well come in."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes please, you're open for business I take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Always open, come on in."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Turns around and musters his way inside. As soon as you step in the door and look around, this place looks like an episode of Hoarders. It is just floor-to-ceiling, wall-to-wall, stacks of anything and everything: knick-knacks, small stuffed animals, toys, books, glasses, and goblets. It is the biggest, crammed flea-market into a small shed-like space you've seen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughing)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin climbs back up onto Nott's shoulder and nestles in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (meowing)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am scouting the city for books, I am starved for books.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well we've got books here."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes sir, I'm sorry what is your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oglen. Oglen Hornsblower."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oglen Hornsblower.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And welcome to my collection. You want to buy something, let me know."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well I see you sell a great many things in here, books included. This is just things you've collected throughout your lifetime?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right. Boughten, traded for, found."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know what you just said, but I am interested in books. Particularly in the arcane realm, but any kind of book. Do you have anything that you just outright know is out of the ordinary?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm sure we've got a few. Look around! See what you find. It's half the fun, half the "journey."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, friend, let's-- It's like Winter's Crest morning for me and I'm scanning the shelves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you give me something to look for? To distract me and give me a mission to go on, please?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. You want to find some sort of tool that helps you do what you do best.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Investigation check, that is a 21.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I rolled a 21 investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The smell in there is dusty and moldy and you do find there is some subtle water damage and some mildew growing in one far corner and you're like ugh, put that back. However, you rolled really high. Two things catch your eye. One, there appears to be the remnants of some sort of notebook, a sketchbook that is written in a language you do not understand-- What languages do you know?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I speak Sylvan, Common, and Celestial and I also can Comprehend Languages as a ritual spell but I think that takes some time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does take ten minutes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you glance through the book, and while you cannot read the text you do recognize that there are elements at the back of the book that have a hint of arcane nature. That's one of two books you find with that roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's like the adult section for him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. The second book you find is written in Zemnian, which you can read.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's correct.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The title translates to Fiends of Folklore.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm so happy. You have quite a shop here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know I do!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have some real treasures. I'm particularly interested in both of these books.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good choices, good choices."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know though, I don't think that-- I mean I'm rather tight on coin at the moment so--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's too bad."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe my eyes are too big for my stomach.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's pulling the books away from you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much would you part with these for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sniffs) He holds of the Fiends of Folklore book, "Three gold pieces. This one, (sniffs)-- "ten gold pieces."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which one is which?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Fiends of Folklore is the three, the other tome.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The arcane, weird one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not quite sure what's in it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Would you have any interest in a magic cat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm sorry?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Reappears next to the little man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (yelps) He like throws the books and grabs nearby this large sack and starts-- angrily beating the cat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll take that as a no!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Childhood cat, destroyed!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He does hit Frumpkin. Frumpkin takes one point of bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That might be it, I don't really know. I didn't think that this would happen so quickly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Faced with our own mortality.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Frumpkin point two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, he updates overnight as long as he's plugged in, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hold on, I have to see if Frumpkin is still here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Must be plugged in and connected to Wifi.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Type in your passcode if you agree to the terms.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One hit point of damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's still here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Frumpkin immediately darts off jumps on your shoulder, turns around and (hisses).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you don't like cats, I understand that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry, it caught me off-guard."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well I was trying to sample the merchandise for you. Because if it was just a cat it was just a cat, but this one-- changes to my other shoulder-- he's a magic cat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can roll him in mud, he comes back clean. He disappears, he reappears, he brings you things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Can you make him go away?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you. Now we can continue to talk money."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm interested, and thank you for giving me the time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. Sorry about your cat, friend."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's okay. Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have I heard all of this conversation?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've been hearing all of it, but you've also found, amongst the chaos, a brass baby bottle that's fairly dented, but it's very shiny and polished, you can already see on the inside. You find a new flask, actually. It's very tarnished, but you spit and rub it a little bit. It looks to be of very fine metallic material. You're not entirely sure, you'd have to clean it, but it looks like very nice quality material.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I'll try to trade my flask with that flask.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a sleight of hand check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Indiana Jones style.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. More. No, that's right. 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now, your flask, which still has liquor in it, is left behind for the empty flask you receive. However, without an instance of anyone even paying attention. It is yours. You can write in your inventory you are now the owner of a platinum flask.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit! Okay! It's a baby bottle, or maybe a rattle? What'd you say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Baby bottle. Looks like it was used as a bottle for a very upper-class family.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're already so ahead, though!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know. But I can't resist. I'll try to take one more look and pocket that as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make another sleight of hand check, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It just vanishes into your cloak! It's the craziest thing! It was there and it's gone!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we going to leave now? Should we leave? I think we should leave. Maybe we should go. Do you need some money? I could lend you some money, if you want.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe we'll come back tomorrow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Lovely place you got here!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Piggyback?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, please!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll hold these books for you! Come back when you can!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Within the week, I promise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Have a good day, little girl!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys exit the building.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry! I did it again, I couldn't help it. I took some things. Do you think he noticed? Do you think we're in trouble? Maybe we should hurry back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think he saw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Are you cross with me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. Just wait one moment, okay? Wait for me here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I heard you talking about money, by the way, I could lend you some, if you'd like.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait right here. I cast Detect Magic just before I walk back into the store. I look all around. What are your hours, here? As I look to see if there is anything besides that book, anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance throughout the interior, and you don't sense anything magical, unfortunately, within the piles of rubble.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Besides the book he put down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But he answers. "Oh! All hours! I don't really "close. I don't really sleep."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Middle of the night, even?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sure!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Business is business. Thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No worries. See you then!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bis später.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pee shmiter!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That guy does not speak Zemnian!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he does not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's go back to the hotel, shall we?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While they're away, you guys wait there for a bit, getting stir crazy in the process of waiting in your room. Jester and Beauregard, there's a knock at your door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hello?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please open, it's Crownsguard."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hold on, I'm naked! (whispering) Yeah, I don't know. Do you want to put clothes on? Should we take our clothes off?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you say that because you wanted to tell me something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I just wanted to make them wait. Okay, I'm dressed now!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like that. We're giving them-- authority. Got the upper hand. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a power play.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we invite them in or are we going to--? You open the door. I'm going to sit, unassuming, on the bed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sit! Come in, please.
